name: NSApplication.ActivationPolicy
desc: Activation policies (used by activationPolicy) that control whether and how an app may be activated.

items.name: case regular
items.desc: The application is an ordinary app that appears in the Dock and may have a user interface.

items.name: case accessory
items.desc: The application doesn’t appear in the Dock and doesn’t have a menu bar, but it may be activated programmatically or by clicking on one of its windows.

items.name: case prohibited
items.desc: The application doesn’t appear in the Dock and may not create windows or be activated.
